moxie

Enum MoxieOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<MoxieOptions>
      • moxie.MoxieOptions
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<MoxieOptions>

    public enum MoxieOptions
extends Enum<MoxieOptions>
    Options that can be specified in the creation of mocks, spies or groups.

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      GROUP_DEFAULTS
      1 Represents Moxie's default settings for Groups (ORDERED).
      IGNORE_BACKGROUND_FAILURES
      Deprecated. 
      This flag is a tested and supported feature of Moxie, but you really should fix your code/tests instead of using it! Consider using PERMISSIVE instead.
      MOCK_DEFAULTS
      Represents Moxie's default settings for mocks/spies (UNORDERED and PRESCRIPTIVE).
      NO_IGNORE_BACKGROUND_FAILURES
      Observe the default behavior - fail tests when mock errors are thrown in background threads.
      NO_TRACE
      Observe the default behavior - for performance reasons, don't save stack traces.
      ORDERED
      The order in which expectations are fulfilled on this mock/group will not be checked.
      PARTIAL
      The default behavior for methods on this mock will be to pass control to the original implementation of the method on the concrete class being mocked.
      PERMISSIVE
      Calls to this mock that do not fulfill any previously specified expectation will perform the default behavior without raising an error.
      PRESCRIPTIVE
      Calls to this mock that do not fulfill any previously specified expectation will raise an error.
      TRACE
      Save stack traces when instantiating new mocks or recording method invocations.
      UNORDERED
      The order in which expectations are fulfilled on this mock/group will be strictly checked; out-of-order calls will fail.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • UNORDERED

        public static final MoxieOptions UNORDERED
        The order in which expectations are fulfilled on this mock/group will be strictly checked; out-of-order calls will fail.

      • ORDERED

        public static final MoxieOptions ORDERED
        The order in which expectations are fulfilled on this mock/group will not be checked.

      • PERMISSIVE

        public static final MoxieOptions PERMISSIVE
        Calls to this mock that do not fulfill any previously specified expectation will perform the default behavior without raising an error.

        On normal mocks, the default behavior for most methods is to return the method return type's default value (null for methods returning objects, zero or false for methods returning primitives). The exceptions are three methods from Object:

        • hashCode() returns the value of System.identityHashCode() for the mock.
        • equals() implements referential equality.
        • toString() returns a default string giving the name of the mock object.
        On PARTIAL mocks, the default behavior is to pass control to the method on the class being mocked.

        On spies, the default behavior is always to delegate to the underlying object.

      • PRESCRIPTIVE

        public static final MoxieOptions PRESCRIPTIVE
        Calls to this mock that do not fulfill any previously specified expectation will raise an error.

        Note that hashCode(), equals(), toString() and finalize() will not raise errors on PRESCRIPTIVE mocks/spies unless a never() expectation is explicitly set for those methods.

      • PARTIAL

        public static final MoxieOptions PARTIAL
        The default behavior for methods on this mock will be to pass control to the original implementation of the method on the concrete class being mocked.

        This option only makes sense for mocks of concrete classes; specifying it for an interface mock or a spy will raise an IllegalArgumentException.

        Most users of this option will probably want to specify PERMISSIVE at the same time, lest unexpected method calls raise an error.

      • TRACE

        public static final MoxieOptions TRACE
        Save stack traces when instantiating new mocks or recording method invocations. Makes Moxie slightly slower (~2x), but sometimes produces more informative error messages.

      • NO_TRACE

        public static final MoxieOptions NO_TRACE
        Observe the default behavior - for performance reasons, don't save stack traces. Opposite of TRACE.

      • IGNORE_BACKGROUND_FAILURES

        public static final MoxieOptions IGNORE_BACKGROUND_FAILURES
        Deprecated. This flag is a tested and supported feature of Moxie, but you really should fix your code/tests instead of using it! Consider using PERMISSIVE instead.
        Don't cause tests to fail on verify() if there has been an unexpected mock invocation in a background thread. (The unexpected invocation will still throw an error in that thread, but this is unlikely to fail your test unless you've written it to check for that error and/or its side effects.)

      • NO_IGNORE_BACKGROUND_FAILURES

        public static final MoxieOptions NO_IGNORE_BACKGROUND_FAILURES
        Observe the default behavior - fail tests when mock errors are thrown in background threads. Opposite of IGNORE_BACKGROUND_FAILURES.

      • MOCK_DEFAULTS

        public static final MoxieOptions MOCK_DEFAULTS
        Represents Moxie's default settings for mocks/spies (UNORDERED and PRESCRIPTIVE).

      • GROUP_DEFAULTS

        public static final MoxieOptions GROUP_DEFAULTS
        1 Represents Moxie's default settings for Groups (ORDERED).

      • values

        public static MoxieOptions[] values()
        Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared. This method may be used to iterate over the constants as follows: 
        for (MoxieOptions c : MoxieOptions.values())
    System.out.println(c);
        Returns:
        an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared
